definition: car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)

sentences.english: Look, the moving van is backing into their driveway.
sentences.chinese: 你看，运家具的大卡车正在往他们家的车道上倒车呢。

sentences.english: His main complaint was that, at just three lanes, the M25 was not big or bold enough.
sentences.chinese: 他那时还抱怨说M25公路只有三车道，不够宽。

sentences.english: Park the car in the driveway so it's off the street.
sentences.chinese: 把车停在车道上，要开时便可以直接通到马路。
那条路已改成了双车道。

sentences.english: He lives on the corner of Cedar Street and Lakeview Drive.
sentences.chinese: 他住在柏树街及湖景车道的交界处。

sentences.english: The lorry was travelling at 20mph in the slow lane.
sentences.chinese: 卡车在慢车道上以20英里的时速行驶。

sentences.english: But, what if the bike lanes then become congested?
sentences.chinese: 但是，自行车道要是变得拥挤那怎么办？

sentences.english: This is a very busy road, with approximately 8 lanes for a pedestrian to cross.
sentences.chinese: 该道路十分繁忙，行人过马路须穿越八个车道的道路。

sentences.english: If you back your car out of the driveway I can get mine in.
sentences.chinese: 你把车退出车道，我的车才能开进去。
出事路段为双向两车道。

sentences.english: This is a good quality highway，and very wide.
sentences.chinese: 这是一条很高级的快车道，而且很宽。

sentences.english: The headlights in the opposite lane made it hard to see.
sentences.chinese: 对面车道上的前灯很难照到这个地方。

sentences.english: It analyses the compatibility and inter-operability of ETC lane equipment.
sentences.chinese: 其中，重点分析了ETC车道设备兼容互换性问题。

sentences.english: He tends the flower beds and evergreens that he has planted in the driveway.
sentences.chinese: 他总是细心呵护着种植在车道边的花圃和常青树。

definition: to go straight/straight forward/fig. to do right
to travel along a route (of vehicles etc)
(of two vehicles traveling in opposite directions) to pass by each other
to go through/to pass through/to be in general use
highway/expressway/same as 高速公路[gao1 su4 gong1 lu4]
pedestrian/traveler on foot/passer-by/official responsible for arranging audiences with the emperor
